description: From Middle English dereinen, from Old French deraisnier (“to explain, defend, to maintain in legal action by proof and reasonings”), from Late Latin derationare (“to discourse, contend in law”).

verbs.description: deraign (third-person singular simple present deraigns, present participle deraigning, simple past and past participle deraigned)

entries.meaning: (law, obsolete, transitive) To prove or to refute by proof, especially on threat of combat.
